column4: Hi can anyone help me setup ndiswrapper-1.53 on ubuntu? The manuals on the ubuntu site are all for 1.43, and don't work.
I could try.. wireless can be a real pain, I am just now getting mine half-way sorted out...
I actually don't know anything about ndiswrapper...
whats the sudo apt-get install for that?
It tells me I have the driver installed
I was f-ing with mine for a long time last night and I am using the wireless now after reinstallin network-manager and rebooting without the ethernet plugged in....
I just used synaptic, I don't really think that's what helped necesarily...
well It says the drivers are installed, so what would you recommend I do?
have you tried booting without the ethernet plugged in?  I know it sounds lame...
I think I have, but i'll try again.

yeah, that was a long shot... one time switching to knetworkmanager helped me but that is not very sound advice either.... sry that you are struggling with wireless I was smacking myself in the head last night over it
